question:
Consider the following pairs:
  1. Sabha and Samiti - Vedic period
  2. Girnar inscription - Rudradaman
  3. Devnam piya - Ashoka
    Which of the above is/are correct?
explanation: Devnam piya means “Beloved of The Gods”. Ashoka has been referred as “Devanampriya Priyadarshi” in Maski edict in Raichur District of Karnataka. Rudradaman-I was a Saka ruler from the Western Kshatrapas dynasty. Sabha and Samiti were the two popular assemblies existed (in early Rig-Vedic) and the assembly hall (Later Rig-Vedic).
